task.title: Storing Custom Stage Libraries with Cloudera Manager (Optional)

context.p: custom stagesstoring through Cloudera Manageruser librariesstoring through Cloudera ManagerIf you develop custom stages, store the stage libraries in a local directory external to the runtime directory. Use an external directory to enable use of the custom stage libraries after upgrades.
For more information about developing your own custom stages, see the following StreamSets tutorial: Creating a Custom StreamSets Destination.

step.cmd: In Cloudera Manager, select the StreamSets service and then click Configuration.

On the Configuration page, in the Data Collector Advanced Configuration Snippet (Safety Valve) for sdc-env.sh field, add the USER_LIBRARIES_DIR environment variable and point it to the custom stage library directory, as follows:
On every node that runs , copy the custom stage libraries to the directory defined for the USER_LIBRARIES_DIR environment variable. Use a directory structure for each custom stage.
step.info: For example to store libraries for a custom stage named customstage1, you would copy them to the following directory: /opt/sdc-user-libs/customstage1
